scenes.voiceover: Hey everyone, welcome back to Classic Reviews. Today, we're diving into the latest flagship from OnePlus, the OnePlus Open. This device is packed with impressive features that make it a strong contender in the premium smartphone market. It boasts a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, a stunning 7.8-inch AMOLED main display, and a versatile camera system that includes a 50MP wide, 48MP ultrawide, and 64MP telephoto lenses. Aimed at tech enthusiasts and power users alike, the OnePlus Open is designed to impress. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) called it 'a solid flagship device with top-tier specs that compete with the best in the market.' Similarly, Dave Lee (Dave2D) mentioned, 'OnePlus has really upped their game with the Open, delivering a premium experience.' User comments on Amazon also highlight the device's performance and display quality. One user said, 'This phone is blazing fast! The display is stunning and the camera quality is top-notch.' With a 5000mAh battery, this beast promises all-day power. Compared to the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 and Google Pixel Fold, the OnePlus Open holds its ground with competitive specs and pricing. Overall, it scores a solid 9 out of 10 for its impressive feature set, though it loses a point for its high price and lack of expandable storage. Stick around as we delve into the design next and see what makes this phone a visual treat.

scenes.voiceover: Next up, let's talk about the design of the OnePlus Open. This device features a sleek and modern design with a glass front and back, and an aluminum frame. It feels premium in hand and has a nice weight to it. Linus Tech Tips mentioned, 'The OnePlus Open has a beautiful design that feels very premium and well-built.' Similarly, The Verge noted, 'OnePlus has nailed the design with the Open. It's sleek, modern, and feels great in hand.' User comments on Flipkart are also positive, with one user saying, 'The design is simply stunning. It feels great to hold and looks very premium.' The glass and aluminum combo adds a bit of heft, and at 202 grams, it's heavier than some competitors like the iPhone 14 Pro and Samsung Galaxy S23. However, the matte finish on the back does a good job of keeping those pesky fingerprints at bay. The build quality is top-notch, with the device feeling sturdy and capable of handling a few bumps. The overall aesthetic is modern and sleek, making it a head-turner. Compared to its rivals, the OnePlus Open stands out for its premium materials and design finesse. However, the weight might be a concern for some users who prefer lighter devices. The design scores a commendable 9 out of 10, losing a point due to its weight. Let's move on to the display and see if it matches the high standards set by the design.

scenes.voiceover: Now, let's dive into the display of the OnePlus Open. This device boasts a 6.7-inch AMOLED main screen with a resolution of 2400 x 1080 pixels, delivering vibrant colors and deep blacks. The cover screen is a 3.26-inch OLED display with a resolution of 720 x 1280 pixels. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) praised the display, stating, 'The OnePlus Open's display is crisp, vibrant, and one of the best I've seen on a foldable device.' Linus Tech Tips also highlighted, 'The color accuracy and brightness are top-notch, making it great for media consumption.' Users on Amazon have echoed these sentiments, with one user commenting, 'The display quality is just amazing, especially the main screen. It's perfect for watching videos and gaming.' The main screen supports a 120Hz refresh rate, providing smooth scrolling and fluid animations, which is a significant plus for gamers and power users. The cover screen, although smaller, is equally impressive with its clarity and brightness, making it convenient for quick tasks. However, some users have pointed out that the crease in the foldable display is still somewhat noticeable, which can be a distraction. Compared to other foldables like the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4, the OnePlus Open holds its own with superior brightness and color accuracy but slightly falters with the fold crease. Overall, the display of the OnePlus Open scores an 8 out of 10, losing points mainly due to the visible crease. Let's move on to performance and see if the OnePlus Open can keep up with its impressive display.

scenes.voiceover: Now, let's talk about the performance of the OnePlus Open. At its core, this device is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, paired with 12GB of RAM and 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. This setup ensures that the OnePlus Open handles everything from heavy multitasking to the most demanding games with ease. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) noted, 'The OnePlus Open performs exceptionally well, even under heavy load. The Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 is a beast.' Linus Tech Tips echoed this sentiment, saying, 'The performance is top-notch, with fast app launches and smooth gameplay.' Users on Amazon have also praised the performance, with one user commenting, 'This phone is lightning fast. I've thrown everything at it, and it hasn't slowed down one bit.' Benchmark scores place the OnePlus Open among the top performers in its category, with an impressive AnTuTu score of over 1 million and Geekbench scores reflecting strong single-core and multi-core performance. However, some users have reported occasional thermal throttling under prolonged heavy use. Compared to devices like the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra and the iPhone 14 Pro, the OnePlus Open holds its own, offering competitive performance at a slightly lower price point. Overall, the performance of the OnePlus Open scores a solid 9 out of 10, losing a point due to thermal management issues. Next, we'll examine the battery life and see how the OnePlus Open fares in real-world usage.

scenes.voiceover: Next, let's dive into the battery life of the OnePlus Open. This device comes equipped with a 5000mAh battery, which OnePlus claims can last an entire day of heavy use. It supports 67W Warp Charge, which promises to juice up the battery from 0 to 100% in just about 30 minutes. Linus Tech Tips mentioned, 'The battery life on the OnePlus Open is solid, easily lasting through a full day on a single charge.' Similarly, Dave Lee (Dave2D) noted, 'With moderate use, you can expect the OnePlus Open to comfortably get through a day and a half.' User comments on Flipkart are generally positive, with one user stating, 'The battery life is impressive. I can go a full day with heavy usage and still have charge left.' However, some users on Amazon have mentioned that the battery drains faster when using power-intensive applications. The battery health features are also commendable, with intelligent charging algorithms that help prolong battery lifespan by learning your charging habits. When compared to the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, which also has a 5000mAh battery but supports only 45W fast charging, the OnePlus Open stands out with its quicker charging speed. Overall, the OnePlus Open scores an 8 out of 10 for its battery life. It offers excellent endurance and fast charging, but loses a couple of points due to faster drain under heavy loads and the lack of wireless charging. Let's move on to the next segment, where we'll explore the camera performance of the OnePlus Open.

scenes.voiceover: Now, let's focus on one of the most talked-about features of the OnePlus Open – its camera system. The device boasts a versatile setup, including a 50MP wide, a 48MP ultrawide, and a 64MP telephoto lens. Additionally, it features a 32MP cover camera and a 20MP inner front camera for selfies. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) highlighted, 'The camera system on the OnePlus Open is quite impressive, especially the 64MP telephoto lens which offers stunning zoom capabilities.' Linus Tech Tips mentioned, 'The ultrawide camera maintains excellent color accuracy and detail, even in challenging lighting conditions.' User comments on Amazon also reflect this sentiment, with one user stating, 'The camera quality is superb, particularly the telephoto lens which captures incredible detail.' However, some users on Reddit noted that the camera performance in low light could be improved. When compared to the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, which also features a high-resolution camera setup, the OnePlus Open holds its own with competitive image quality and features but falls slightly short in low-light conditions. Overall, the OnePlus Open scores an 8 out of 10 for its camera performance. It excels in versatility and image quality but loses points due to low-light performance. scenes.voiceover: Next, let's dive into the software experience on the OnePlus Open. The device runs on OxygenOS based on Android 13, which promises a smooth and intuitive user interface. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) commented, 'OxygenOS continues to be one of the most user-friendly Android skins out there, with minimal bloatware and a clean design.' Similarly, Android Authority praised the software for its speed and responsiveness, stating, 'OxygenOS on the OnePlus Open is incredibly fast and fluid, making daily tasks a breeze.' User feedback from Amazon and Flipkart also highlights the positive experience, with one user mentioning, 'The UI is clean and fast without unnecessary apps clogging up the system.' However, some users on Reddit pointed out that there are occasional bugs and that the absence of certain features found in other Android skins can be a drawback for some. Compared to rivals like Samsung's One UI and Google's Pixel Experience, OxygenOS holds its own with its simplicity and speed, though it may lack some of the customizations offered by its competitors. Overall, the software experience on the OnePlus Open scores a solid 8 out of 10, thanks to its user-friendly interface and performance, but loses points for minor bugs and fewer customization options. Up next, we'll evaluate the value for money the OnePlus Open offers in the Indian market.

scenes.voiceover: Alright, now let's talk about value for money. The OnePlus Open is priced at ₹1,49,999 in India, positioning it firmly in the premium segment. This device packs top-tier specs, including the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, 12GB of RAM, and a versatile camera system. Linus Tech Tips states, 'For the price, you're getting a lot of high-end hardware that competes with the best in the market.' Similarly, Geekyranjit mentions, 'The price is justified given the performance and features, but it's still a significant investment.' User comments on Amazon reflect mixed sentiments, with one user saying, 'It's expensive but worth every penny for the performance and camera,' while another pointed out, 'Great phone, but there are cheaper options with similar specs.' Compared to its rivals like the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra and Google Pixel 7 Pro, the OnePlus Open offers competitive features but at a slightly lower price point. However, the lack of expandable storage and the premium pricing might be deterrents for some users. Overall, the OnePlus Open scores an 8 out of 10 in terms of value for money. It excels in performance and features but loses points for its high price and lack of expandable storage. Up next, we'll wrap things up with our final thoughts and recommendations.

scenes.voiceover: In conclusion, the OnePlus Open is a strong contender in the premium smartphone market. Its standout features include the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor, a stunning AMOLED display, and a versatile camera system. Marques Brownlee (MKBHD) calls it 'a solid flagship device with top-tier specs that compete with the best in the market.' Linus Tech Tips adds, 'For the price, you're getting a lot of high-end hardware that competes with the best in the market.' However, it does have its drawbacks, such as the lack of expandable storage and its premium pricing. User feedback has been mostly positive, with comments like, 'It's expensive but worth every penny for the performance and camera,' but there are also concerns about the high cost, with another user stating, 'Great phone, but there are cheaper options with similar specs.' Compared to its competitors like the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra and Google Pixel 7 Pro, the OnePlus Open offers a competitive feature set at a slightly lower price point. But does it justify the investment? Overall, we give the OnePlus Open an 8 out of 10. It excels in performance, display quality, and camera capabilities but loses points for its high price and lack of expandable storage. If you're in the market for a premium smartphone and can overlook these minor drawbacks, the OnePlus Open is definitely worth considering.
